title.narrative: Crear capacidades locales para el fortalecimiento organizativo, mejoramiento de la produccin agroecolgica y la economa familiar en comunidades indgenas de Mojarra y Llano Tugr, Comarca Ngbe Bugl

description.narrative: Indigenous farming communities in the Ngbe-Bugl Comarca face a variety of challenges, including an inadequate food supply, extreme weather events, and lack of access to basic SERVICES The IAF supports community-led solutions that enhance food security and disaster resilience in Panama. Our grantee partner, Fundacin de Organizaciones Campesinas e Indgenas de Veraguas (FOCIV), offers technical assistance to community leaders to develop skills in sustainable farming, adaptation to natural disasters, and engaging local officials to provide access to basic SERVICES FOCIVs activities strengthen grassroots organizations and communities through education and training, improving food security among the Ngbe-Bugl.

The IAF supports community-led solutions that enhance food security and disaster resilience in Panama. Our grantee partner Fundacin de Organizaciones Campesinas e Indgenas de Veraguas (FOCIV) offers technical assistance to community leaders to develop skills in sustainable farming adaptation to natural disasters and engaging local officials to provide access to basic services. FOCIV's activities strengthen grassroots organizations and communities through education and training improving food security among the Ngbe-Bugl.

title.narrative: Education/Training Grant

description.narrative: Fundacin de Organizaciones Campesinas e Indgenas de Veraguas (FOCIV) will train the members of three grassroots organizations in Veraguas in agroecological practices that improve their food supply and in the skills necessary to negotiate to obtain government services. It will also help the organizations with filing to become legally constituted. The work is expected to benefit 546 Panamanians directly and 1,694 indirectly.

participating-org.narrative: Fundacin de Organizaciones Campesinas e Indgenas de Veraguas

receiver-org.narrative: Fundacin de Organizaciones Campesinas e Indgenas de Veraguas

title.narrative: Environment Grant

description.narrative: ANCON will work with African descendent and indigenous groups in 10 communities in and near the Punto Patio Reserve in the Darien to conduct feasibility studies and provide seed funding for environmentally- sustainable micro- and small enterprises. The project will benefit 200 entrepreneurs directly and 2,000 area residents indirectly.

participating-org.narrative: Asociacin Nacional para la Conservacin de la Naturaleza

receiver-org.narrative: Asociacin Nacional para la Conservacin de la Naturaleza

title.narrative: Environment Grant

description.narrative: Consejo Consultivo de las Subcuencas de los Ros Los Hules, Tinajones y Cao Quebrado (CC). CC will apply the plan that it developed to manage the Los Hules, Tinajones and Cao Quebrado watersheds and share it with all schools and grassroots groups that provided input. To assure the continued application of the plan after IAF funding ends, CC will also engage local authorities. Collaborative activities, including monitoring, reforestation and soil and water management, will directly involve 60 Panamanians and will benefit another 400.

title.narrative: Fortaleciendo la resiliencia ante la pandemia del COVID-19 en el Gran Chaco Americano

description.narrative: Indigenous and creole communities in the Gran Chaco region spanning Argentina, Bolivia, and Paraguay are especially vulnerable to the effects of the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. They face high levels of food insecurity and economic and social isolation. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions to create economic opportunity and social inclusion for Indigenous people, women, and youth in Argentina, Bolivia, and Paraguay. AVINA will support Redes Chaco, a network of grassroots, civil society, and private sector organizations, to build local decision-making capacity to respond to the challenges of the pandemic. Redes Chaco is encouraging community engagement with the government and private sector to support grassroots solutions, enhance access to reliable information and technology, and improve food security by restarting economic activities for hundreds of communities isolated due to the effects of COVID-19 in the Gran Chaco Americano. This grant is part of the IAF's broader COVID-19 response strategy.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

receiver-org.narrative: Fundacin AVINA
Fundacin AVINA

title.narrative: Small Project for Sustainable Development of the Gran Chaco

description.narrative: Some of the poorest and most neglected communities in Argentina, Bolivia, and Paraguay are located in the Gran Chaco, where residents depend on subsistence farming and day labor for their livelihoods. Fundacin AVINA (AVINA) works with grassroots and non-governmental organizations such as Red de Organizaciones del Chaco Americano (Redes Chaco) to further community-based development in collaboration with public, private, and international donors. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions to expand economic opportunity in Latin America and the Caribbean. AVINA's activities strengthen grassroots organizations through education and training and build peer-to-peer learning and action networks.

receiver-org.narrative: Fundacin AVINA

title.narrative: Small Project for Sustainable Development of the Gran Chaco

description.narrative: Some of the poorest and most neglected communities in Argentina Bolivia and Paraguay are located in the Gran Chaco where residents depend on subsistence farming and day labor for their livelihoods. Fundacin AVINA (AVINA) works with grassroots and non-governmental organizations such as Red de Organizaciones del Chaco Americano (Redes Chaco) to further community-based development in collaboration with public private and international donors. At the IAF we support community-led solutions to expand economic opportunity in Latin America and the Caribbean. AVINA's activities strengthen grassroots organizations through education and training and build peer-to-peer learning and action networks.

receiver-org.narrative: Fundacin AVINA

title.narrative: Agriculture/Food Production Grant

description.narrative: Agricultura Sostenible, Conservacin y Desarrollo (ASCODE) will introduce agroecological techniques that increase its production of yams and cassava and enable the organization to reach new markets by qualifying for the certification required to add value to its crops through processing and packaging. The resulting increase in income will benefit 150 Panamanians directly and another 500 indirectly.

receiver-org.narrative: Agricultura Sostenible, Conservacin y Desarrollo

title.narrative: Strengthening Agroecological Production Capacities and Resilience to the Management of COVID-19 in the community of Cerro Pelado, urum, Ngbe Bugle Region

description.narrative: Farming families in and around the Cerro Pelado in Veraguas, Panama, struggle with food insecurity and lack access to the equipment and resources they need to strengthen agricultural production and ensure healthy livelihoods. The effects of the COVID-19 pandemic and ensuing economic contraction have further threatened food security, especially as newly-unemployed family members return to the community. Asociacin Para el Desarrollo Integral Comunitario de Cerro Pelado (ADICO) strengthens community engagement through technical training and shared resources and encourages smallholder producers to use sustainable, limited contact methods to cultivate and sell coffee, bananas, rice and vegetables. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions to expand economic opportunity in Panama. ADICOs activities promote smallholder agriculture and food production methods that enhance food security and reduce the transmission of COVID-19, helping provide meaningful opportunities for communities to thrive.

participating-org.narrative: Asociacin Para el Desarrollo Integral Comunitario

title.narrative: Centro de Formacin Socio Ambiental y para el Desarrollo Humano de Tierras Altas

description.narrative: In the fertile mountains of the Chiriqu province in western Panama temporary agricultural workersincluding many from the indigenous Ngbe communitylive in precarious dwellings on hillsides and near streams. As more and more land is transformed into farmland these homes face increased risk of flooding during the rainy season. At the IAF we support community-led solutions to strengthen local governance and prepare for natural disasters. Our grantee partner Fundacin para el Desarrollo Integral Comunitario y Conservacin de los Ecosistemas en Panam (FUNDICCEP) works with local communities to promote wider participation in disaster readiness committees strengthen disaster readiness and risk management plans and ensure that Ngbe and other workers' voices are heard and needs are met in community decision-making.

participating-org.narrative: Fundacin para el Desarrollo Integral Comunitario y Conservacin de los Ecosistemas en Panam

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance

title.narrative: Control de Pez Leon Para La Conservacin Ecosistema en la Provincia de Bocas del Toro

description.narrative: Lionfish a species native to the Pacific Ocean has invaded the Caribbean basin where it has no natural predators. With an insatiable appetite and the ability to rapidly multiply the lionfish is decimating aquatic ecosystems which threatens food security and income for fishing communities in Bocas del Toro Panama. The IAF supports community-led solutions to improving natural resource management and creating economic opportunity. Our grantee partner the Unin de Pescadores Artesanales Bocatoreos (UPESABO) is an artisanal fishers association working with its members and other Panamanian organizations to control the lionfish population including by promoting its consumption. Through training environmental education and updating market infrastructure UPESABO improves the lives of its members while also protecting the community's natural heritage.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

receiver-org.narrative: Unin de Pescadores Artesanales Bocatoreos

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance

title.narrative: FORTALECIENDO EL MANEJO PARTICIPATIVO COMUNITARIO, DENTRO DE LA ZONA ESPECIAL DE MANEJO MARINO-COSTERA (ZEMMC) LA ZONA SUR DE VERAGUAS

description.narrative: Southern Veraguas province in Panama has beautiful beaches and a rich variety of marine life, yet few job opportunities for people who live there. Almost every family in the area has at least one relative who has moved elsewhere in search of employment. At the IAF, we support community-led approaches to expand economic opportunity and provide jobs that help people stay rooted in their communities. Our grantee partner Fundacin Agua y Tierra (FUNDAT) works with local groups to develop a strong, community-based tourism infrastructure that both takes advantage of and protects the numerous natural resources found there. Through small business development and better management of natural resources, FUNDAT is supporting local communities in becoming self-sustaining.

title.narrative: Acciones de base comunitaria para el desarrollo sostenible y conservacin en Darin, Panam

description.narrative: In the face of widespread loss of the Darien Rainforest, the Embera and Wounaan Indigenous communities in Panama have shifted from hunter gathering to farming. These communities need to ensure their food security, yet may put their long-term livelihoods at risk if they use agricultural techniques that further damage the fragile forest ecosystem. The IAF supports community-led approaches to strengthen resilience through sustainable agriculture. Our grantee partner, Fundacin Rapaces y Bosques - Panam (FRBP), supports Indigenous communities in the Darien to adopt sustainable agricultural practices that increase incomes and food security while also protecting rainforest ecosystems. This grant is part of the IAF's broader COVID-19 response strategy.

participating-org.narrative: Fundacin Rapaces y Bosques de Panam

title.narrative: Productive and economic promotion of the network of producers and artisans in the Ngbe and Bugle Comarca, Panama

description.narrative: Indigenous youth in Panama's Ngobe-Bugl Comarca have few income-generating opportunities available to them, leading to high out-migration rates to nearby cities and a loss of engagement with their traditions. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions to support cultural preservation as a means of expanding economic opportunity. IAF grantee Programa de Promocin y Desarrollo Social (PRODESO) works with a local network of youth artisans and agricultural producers to develop their skills in traditional production techniques and earn a living in their home communities. PRODESO's effort will help the local network grow, creating income-generating opportunities for young people while supporting their efforts to preserve their heritage.

participating-org.narrative: Programa de Promocin y Desarrollo Social

title.narrative: Strengthening networks and social fabric for disaster risk reduction in Chiriqu Province, Panama

description.narrative: Extreme weather and accelerating natural disasters are affecting the region's most vulnerable places. These environmental challenges are pushing organizations to learn and adapt. The IAF supports community-based organizations to respond to medium and long-term priorities of communities affected by hurricanes, earthquakes, and other natural disasters. Our grantee Fundacin para el Desarrollo Integral, Comunitario y Conservacin de Ecosistemas en Panam (FUNDICCEP) is supporting disaster recovery and resilience efforts at the grassroots level. It will work with local communities to promote wider participation in disaster readiness committees, strengthen risk management plans, and ensure that a diverse set of voices, including Indigenous Ngbe, are heard and included in community decision-making. This grant is part of the IAF's efforts to address the root causes of irregular migration in Central America through disaster recovery and resilience. It is one of a cohort of grants funded through the Partnership for Disaster Recovery and Resilience, which makes strategic investments that strengthen the capacity for action of local grassroots organizations in Central America and southern Mexico.

participating-org.narrative: Fundacin para el Desarrollo Integral Comunitario y Conservacin de los Ecosistemas en Panam

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

receiver-org.narrative: Fundacin para el Desarrollo Integral Comunitario y Conservacin de los Ecosistemas en Panam

It will work with local communities to promote wider participation in disaster readiness committees, strengthen risk management plans, and ensure that a diverse set of voices, including Indigenous Ngbe, are heard and included in community decision-making.This grant is part of the IAF's efforts to address the root causes of irregular migration in Central America through disaster recovery and resilience. It is one of a cohort of grants funded through the Partnership for Disaster Recovery and Resilience, which makes strategic investments that strengthen the capacity for action of local grassroots organizations in Central America and southern Mexico.

participating-org.narrative: Fundacin para el Desarrollo Integral Comunitario y Conservacin de los Ecosistemas en Panam

title.narrative: Tejiendo redes y articulacin social para la reduccin del riesgo de desastre en la provincia de Chiriqu, Panam

description.narrative: Extreme weather and accelerating natural disasters are affecting the region's most vulnerable places. These environmental challenges are pushing organizations to learn and adapt. The IAF supports community-based organizations to respond to medium and long-term priorities of communities affected by hurricanes, earthquakes, and other natural disasters. Our grantee Fundacin para el Desarrollo Integral, Comunitario y Conservacin de Ecosistemas en Panam (FUNDICCEP) is supporting disaster recovery and resilience efforts at the grassroots level. It will work with local communities to promote wider participation in disaster readiness committees, strengthen risk management plans, and ensure that a diverse set of voices, including Indigenous Ngbe, are heard and included in community decision-making.This grant is part of the IAF's efforts to address the root causes of irregular migration in Central America through disaster recovery and resilience. It is one of a cohort of grants funded through the Partnership for Disaster Recovery and Resilience, which makes strategic investments that strengthen the capacity for action of local grassroots organizations in Central America and southern Mexico.

It will work with local communities to promote wider participation in disaster readiness committees, strengthen risk management plans, and ensure that a diverse set of voices, including Indigenous Ngbe, are heard and included in community decision-making.This grant is part of the IAF's efforts to address the root causes of irregular migration in Central America through disaster recovery and resilience. title.narrative: Control de Pez Leon Para La Conservacin Ecosistema en la Provincia de Bocas del Toro

description.narrative: Lionfish a species native to the Pacific Ocean has invaded the Caribbean basin where it has no natural predators. With an insatiable appetite and the ability to rapidly multiply the lionfish is decimating aquatic ecosystems which threatens food security and income for fishing communities in Bocas del Toro Panama. The IAF supports community-led solutions to improving natural resource management and creating economic opportunity. Our grantee partner the Unin de Pescadores Artesanales Bocatoreos (UPESABO) is an artisanal fishers association working with its members and other Panamanian organizations to control the lionfish population including by promoting its consumption. Through training environmental education and updating market infrastructure UPESABO improves the lives of its members while also protecting the community's natural heritage.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

receiver-org.narrative: Unin de Pescadores Artesanales Bocatoreos

title.narrative: Control de Pez Leon Para La Conservacin Ecosistema en la Provincia de Bocas del Toro

description.narrative: Lionfish, a species native to the Pacific Ocean, has invaded the Caribbean basin where it has no natural predators. With an insatiable appetite and the ability to rapidly multiply, the lionfish is decimating aquatic ecosystems, which threatens food security and income for fishing communities in Bocas del Toro, Panama. The IAF supports community-led solutions to improving natural resource management and creating economic opportunity. Our grantee partner, the Unin de Pescadores Artesanales Bocatoreos (UPESABO), is an artisanal fishers association working with its members and other Panamanian organizations to control the lionfish population, including by promoting its consumption. Through training, environmental education, and updating market infrastructure, UPESABO improves the lives of its members while also protecting the community's natural heritage.

title.narrative: FORTALECIENDO EL MANEJO PARTICIPATIVO COMUNITARIO, DENTRO DE LA ZONA ESPECIAL DE MANEJO MARINO-COSTERA (ZEMMC) LA ZONA SUR DE VERAGUAS

description.narrative: Southern Veraguas province in Panama has beautiful beaches and a rich variety of marine life, yet few job opportunities for people who live there. Almost every family in the area has at least one relative who has moved elsewhere in search of employment. At the IAF, we support community-led approaches to expand economic opportunity and provide jobs that help people stay rooted in their communities. Our grantee partner Fundacin Agua y Tierra (FUNDAT) works with local groups to develop a strong, community-based tourism infrastructure that both takes advantage of and protects the numerous natural resources found there. Through small business development and better management of natural resources, FUNDAT is supporting local communities in becoming self-sustaining.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

receiver-org.narrative: Fundacin Agua y Tierra

title.narrative: Acciones de base comunitaria para el desarrollo sostenible y conservacin en Darin, Panam

description.narrative: In the face of widespread loss of the Darien Rainforest, the Embera and Wounaan Indigenous communities in Panama have shifted from hunter gathering to farming. These communities need to ensure their food security, yet may put their long-term livelihoods at risk if they use agricultural techniques that further damage the fragile forest ecosystem. The IAF supports community-led approaches to strengthen resilience through sustainable agriculture. Our grantee partner, Fundacin Rapaces y Bosques - Panam (FRBP), supports Indigenous communities in the Darien to adopt sustainable agricultural practices that increase incomes and food security while also protecting rainforest ecosystems.This grant is part of the IAF's broader COVID-19 response strategy.

participating-org.narrative: Fundacin Rapaces y Bosques de Panam

These communities need to ensure their food security, yet may put their long-term livelihoods at risk if they use agricultural techniques that further damage the fragile forest ecosystem. The IAF supports community-led approaches to strengthen resilience through sustainable agriculture. Our grantee partner, Fundacin Rapaces y Bosques - Panam (FRBP), supports Indigenous communities in the Darien to adopt sustainable agricultural practices that increase incomes and food security while also protecting rainforest ecosystems.This grant is part of the IAF's broader COVID-19 response strategy.

title.narrative: Rescate y Establecimiento de plantaciones de Cacao Criollo en Sistemas Agroforestales con Productores(as)Indgenas, Afrodescendientes y Campesinos

description.narrative: The cacao farms of Afro-Indigenous farmers in Bocas del Toro, Panama are more than 50 years old and at the end of their productive life. Low yields lead to reduced incomes, which drives migration from the region. The Cooperativa de Servicios Mltiples de Cacao Bocatorea (COCABO) supports farmers to renovate cacao plantations and implement organic cultivation techniques. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions to expand economic opportunity in Panama. COCABO's efforts will increase productivity and incomes among farmer members. Through its efforts to define and market the chocolate flavor profile produced in the area, COCABO will increase demand for their product, ultimately enabling them to command a higher price for it, expanding economic opportunities for small farmers and their families in the area.

receiver-org.narrative: Cooperativa de Cacao Bocatorea R.L

description.narrative: Club Rotario de David (Club Rotario), $123,535, over two years Club Rotario will improve the job skills, housing, and access to water and sanitation of the indigenous population in the Chiriqu portion of the Comarca Ngbe Bugl. The grantee's goal is better employment possibilities and living standards for about 500 people. Another 2,500 individuals will benefit indirectly from its activities. (PN-285)

title.narrative: Promotion of the Tol Public Library as a Center for Cultural Community Development

description.narrative: FBN will develop the public library in Tol, Chiriqu, into a model facility that will serve as a center where 12,000 residents can become involved in cultural events and community projects. The library will offer research and planning activities, reading and literacy programs, opportunities to participate in the recovery of local oral traditions, and training for teachers, community leaders and parents in the use of library resources.

receiver-org.narrative: Fundacin Biblioteca Nacional de Panam

title.narrative: Capacity Building and Marketing Support for the Promotion of Panamanian Handicrafts

description.narrative: PROARTESANA will improve the skills, earnings, self-esteem, cultural pride and market participation of about 300 craftspeople, mostly women, from Panama City, the central provinces, indigenous reserves and other areas. The grantee will provide training and technical assistance to develop techniques and marketing skills so the craftspeople can tap into tourist and other high- end sales outlets, including via the Internet. (PN-290)

title.narrative: Institutional strengthening for the Consejo Consultivo of the Hules-Tinajones and Cao Quebrado watershed with reforestation activities.

description.narrative: Asociacin Panamea para la Sostenibilidad de la Agricultura y la Naturaleza (APASAN), $166,250 over two years. APASAN will work with the Consejo Consultivo de Subcuencas de los Ros Los Hules-Tinajones y Cao Quebrado to legally constitute and further develop a federation of 22 organizations and reforest approximately 12 hectares of watershed, thereby improving the water quality for 2,570 residents of the district of La Chorrera in the regions of Amador, Arosemena, Medoza and Iturralde.

title.narrative: Adding value to ASCODE's agricultural production

description.narrative: Agricultura Sostenible, Conservacin y Desarrollo (ASCODE) will introduce agroecological techniques that increase its production of yams and cassava and enable the organization to reach new markets by qualifying for the certification required to add value to its crops through processing and packaging. The resulting increase in income will benefit 150 Panamanians directly and another 500 indirectly.

title.narrative: Organizational, Social, and Economic Strengthening of ADICO and Members

description.narrative: The Asociacin para el Desarrollo Integral Comunitario (ADICO) will work with smallholder farming families in and around Cerro Pelado Veraguas Panama to strengthen their organization and increase community engagement. It will also promote ecologically sound methods for cultivating coffee bananas tubers rice and diverse vegetables for family consumption and to sell in local and regional markets to improve household incomes. The project will directly benefit 160 individuals and indirectly benefit 188 more.

title.narrative: Improving livelihoods through the production and marketing of cacao in the province of Bocas del Toro

description.narrative: Cacao producing families in northwestern Panama live in extreme poverty and are plagued by food insecurity. Asociacin de Profesionales y Tcnicos Ngbe-Bugl de Bocas del Toro (APROTENG-B) works with the Cooperativa de Servicios Multiples Ngbe-Cmaco, R.L. and its members to improve cacao production, diversify agricultural production, and increase family income through workshops, farmer-to-farmer exchanges, and youth training. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions to enhance economic opportunity in Panama. APROTENG-Bs activities support smallholder agriculture and food security to ensure meaningful opportunities for communities to thrive.

title.narrative: Improving livelihoods through the production and marketing of cacao in the province of Bocas del Toro

Asociacin de Profesionales y Tcnicos Ngbe-Bugl de Bocas del Toro (APROTENG-B) works with the Cooperativa de Servicios Multiples Ngbe-Cmaco, R.L. and its members to improve cacao production, diversify agricultural production, and increase family income through workshops, farmer-to-farmer exchanges, and youth training. title.narrative: Improving livelihoods through the production and marketing of cacao in the province of Bocas del Toro

description.narrative: The Ngbe culture in the Panamanian province of Bocas de Toro live in extreme poverty and are a socially marginalized group. APROTENG-B works with 58 indigenous Ngbe families to strengthen their cacao cooperative, Cooperative de Servicios Multiples Ngbe-Cmaco, R.L. This support is helping to improve cacao production, increase family income, and bolster civil society. Through workshops, farmer-to-farmer exchanges, and youth promoter training, project participants build skills in cacao production, post-harvest management, and leadership and teamwork. The project benefits 64 producers directly and about 385 persons indirectly. APROTENG-B's activities contribute to expanded economic opportunity in Panama by supporting sustainable smallholder agriculture, local entrepreneurship, and market development.

participating-org.narrative: Asociacin de Profesionales y Tcnicos Ngabe Bugle de Bocas del Toro

title.narrative: Control de Pez Leon Para La Conservacin Ecosistema en la Provincia de Bocas del Toro

description.narrative: Lionfish, a species native to the Pacific Ocean, has invaded the Caribbean basin where it has no natural predators. With an insatiable appetite and the ability to rapidly multiply, the lionfish is decimating aquatic ecosystems, which threatens food security and income for fishing communities in Bocas del Toro, Panama. The IAF supports community-led solutions to improving natural resource management and creating economic opportunity. Our grantee partner, the Unin de Pescadores Artesanales Bocatoreos (UPESABO), is an artisanal fishers association working with its members and other Panamanian organizations to control the lionfish population, including by promoting its consumption. Through training, environmental education, and updating market infrastructure, UPESABO improves the lives of its members while also protecting the communitys natural heritage.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

receiver-org.narrative: Unin de Pescadores Artesanales Bocatoreos

title.narrative: Centro de Formacin Socio Ambiental y para el Desarrollo Humano de Tierras Altas

description.narrative: In the fertile mountains of the Chiriqu province in western Panama, temporary agricultural workersincluding many from the indigenous Ngbe communitylive in precarious dwellings on hillsides and near streams. As more and more land is transformed into farmland, these homes face increased risk of flooding during the rainy season. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions to strengthen local governance and prepare for natural disasters. Our grantee partner, Fundacin para el Desarrollo Integral Comunitario y Conservacin de los Ecosistemas en Panam (FUNDICCEP), works with local communities to promote wider participation in disaster readiness committees, strengthen disaster readiness and risk management plans, and ensure that Ngbe and other workers voices are heard and needs are met in community decision-making.

participating-org.narrative: Fundacin para el Desarrollo Integral Comunitario y Conservacin de los Ecosistemas en Panam
